metadata.title: CVE-2018-10322 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The xfs_dinode_verify function in fs/xfs/libxfs/xfs_inode_buf.c in theLinux kernel through 4.16.3 allows local users to cause a denial of service(xfs_ilock_attr_map_shared invalid pointer dereference) via a crafted xfsimage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10322` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-192.222
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-192.222
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.4.0-192.222
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-192.222
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-192.222
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-192.222
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-192.222
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-192.222
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1140.149
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1144.153
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1116.129
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1116.129
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.15.0-119.120~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-119.120~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.15.0-119.120~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.15.0-119.120~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.15.0-1097.107~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.15.0-1097.107~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.15.0-1085.96~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.15.0-1085.96~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1081.89
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-192.222').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
